intro: Mimulus aurantiacus var. aridus, commonly known as the desert monkeyflower, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its bright orange to red tubular flowers, which are adapted for pollination by hummingbirds. The plant has a low-growing, mat-forming habit with narrow, hairy leaves that help reduce water loss. It thrives in well-drained soils and is drought-tolerant, making it well-suited to harsh, dry environments. Its botanical features reflect its evolutionary adaptations to survive in arid conditions.
